channel.title: Whats more important?
channel.description:
Well I was just woundering what you all think is more important.
For me, I think the GFX's.

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:28, topic:338367”][quote author=Newty link=topic=434754.msg3193503#msg3193503 date=1272503615]
I would say all 3. Everything in a game is intertwined with eachother. I mean, you can’t have good graphics unless you have good programming. (you wouldn’t be able to render high quality graphics without good programming.)

Sorry for the somewhat incoherent post.
[/quote]
i was assuming the OP was referring to the gameplay programming (ie: picking up weapons, shooting, etc).[/quote]

Yeah, that could be how he was referring to it. Now that I have actually reread the other posts in this thread, especially your post above my first post, I really do agree that graphics play a big part in choosing the games you buy.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:27, topic:338367”]I would say all 3. Everything in a game is intertwined with eachother. I mean, you can’t have good graphics unless you have good programming. (you wouldn’t be able to render high quality graphics without good programming.)

Sorry for the somewhat incoherent post.[/quote]
That makes sense also, the programming behind the rendering algorithms in the 3d engines.

Programming dominates every type of media, but i was assuming the OP was referring to the gameplay programming (ie: picking up weapons, shooting, etc).

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?

item.description:

I would say all 3. Everything in a game is intertwined with eachother. I mean, you can’t have good graphics unless you have good programming. (you wouldn’t be able to render high quality graphics without good programming.)

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Ventrozip, post:25, topic:338367”][quote author=Frell link=topic=434754.msg3193483#msg3193483 date=1272502969]

Graphics don’t matter, yes I would, if it was a stable game, with consistency there’s no problem. For god-sakes look at RuneScape 3 years ago. Seriously does everyone base things on looks these days?

By bad we mean horrible. Rushed and sloppy textures, things are animated horribly etc. Runescape didn’t have visually appealing graphics but they were CLEAN and neat.

Heres a thought for everyone. If graphics weren’t so important, why is there an entire industry focused around them and no one is playing text based games?
[/quote]
You got me there. Maybe, MAYBE there could be a balance. But I would say Programming comes first above all.[/quote]
I would prefer good gameplay and decent graphics. And hope for the best of both.

This is crysis, when this game was released the creators said no computers capable of running this game on maximum settings would be available in stores for about 2 years.

Heres conflict denied ops:

Now you have to admit, graphics is what everyone looks for at first. If i see a game with horrible rushed textures in gameinformer i flip the page very quickly. As soon as i see something beautiful i start to read about it and the story, which ultimately ends up of the purchase. Graphics and story are what drives people to buy games, hoping the programming will be playable.

Read full topic

Heres a thought for everyone. If graphics weren’t so important, why is there an entire industry focused around them and no one is playing text based games?[/quote]
You got me there. Maybe, MAYBE there could be a balance. But I would say Programming comes first above all.

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

Ventrozip:

The programming. A program can have a shit GUI and be amazing the inner is what matters. A sexy program is useless if it doesn’t run correctly.

So you’d play a game with horrid graphics but great gameplay?

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Natey, post:19, topic:338367”][quote author=Frell link=topic=434754.msg3192781#msg3192781 date=1272421695]

Programming. The RS version atm (specifically 508+) looks much better, but the RS we all know and love (~317 & ~474) is much, much better. I suppose that would be siding with concept while proving that graphics don’t mean everything though. There’s another choice I suppose you could add; concept.

Notice how jagex is attempting to keep the graphics up to the current generation, it shows they care and the players also care about graphics. I know i would never buy a game that looks like the graphics were rushed just because the gameplay was good. You also have to remember graphic styles, like just cause and grand theft auto.

The only reason we loved the 317 versions wasn’t because of the graphics, it was what held all the memories we have had playing and its how we were used to when we first found out about the game. If you take a player that started playing in 2009 or 2010 they would say the new version is better.

Also, most of the people here are ignorant, so of course they think they can program and they will say programming is better. Even though i can do both and i still say both, its different.
[/quote]Don’t have to be so assy about it, I said both, and I KNOW I can program, just not RSPS, because I’m not going to get a programming/design job saying “YEH I CODED DA RSPS FER MOPERSCAPZ”[/quote]
I didn’t specifically call you out, nor was that post directed towards you.

Read full topic

Also, most of the people here are ignorant, so of course they think they can program and they will say programming is better. Even though i can do both and i still say both, its different.[/quote]Don’t have to be so assy about it, I said both, and I KNOW I can program, just not RSPS, because I’m not going to get a programming/design job saying “YEH I CODED DA RSPS FER MOPERSCAPZ”

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

The Reaper X:

Programming. The RS version atm (specifically 508+) looks much better, but the RS we all know and love (~317 & ~474) is much, much better. I suppose that would be siding with concept while proving that graphics don’t mean everything though. There’s another choice I suppose you could add; concept.

Notice how jagex is attempting to keep the graphics up to the current generation, it shows they care and the players also care about graphics. I know i would never buy a game that looks like the graphics were rushed just because the gameplay was good. You also have to remember graphic styles, like just cause and grand theft auto.

The only reason we loved the 317 versions wasn’t because of the graphics, it was what held all the memories we have had playing and its how we were used to when we first found out about the game. If you take a player that started playing in 2009 or 2010 they would say the new version is better.

Also, most of the people here are ignorant, so of course they think they can program and they will say programming is better. Even though i can do both and i still say both, its different.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

R3volution`:

Depends on the game though.

Again very true…I guess my favorite classic games don’t need them.

I guess this is one of them questions where it goes by the point of view of the person, and what they like in a game, I just wanted to see what everyone else thinks, because it is a well talked about topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Chassy13:

I’d say the programming. Obviously I wouldn’t want to play a game that makes my eyes bleed, but otherwise I would want smooth gameplay over awesome graphics.

But without the graphics you don’t have anything to look at, and without programming and graphics you have nothing but a still image. I go for anything with clean graphics at least, as long it isn’t visually horrible.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Both. Im assuming you’re talking about games, in which case yes it is both. People look for eye candy just as much as they do smooth gameplay. Obviously gameplay is controlled by the programming so it plays a big roll in everything.

They both complement each other and theres really no debate needed :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats more important?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Meh, you can have all the code in the world, but nothiing for it to be used on, GFX’s can be just for show, no need for codes :).
